department: Department of Public Works and Government Services
short_summary: Ventilation and code deficiencies repairs in paint mixing and storage rooms of D175 and D200 buildings.
description: RFP against Supply Arrangement E0225-150564 - Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Services SA list for Nova Scotia. 5 invited firms are: 1. M&R Engineering Limited; 2. Hatch Mott MacDonald; 3. Wood Canada Limited; 4. Tweedie & Associates Consulting; 5. Coles Associates Ltd.

full_summary:
### D175 and D200 Paint Mixing Room Upgrades

**Tender Details:**

* **Reference Number:** WS4323867305-Doc4324014709
* **Publication Date:** November 24, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 18, 2023, 14:00 (EST)
* **Amendment Number:** 5
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** December 20, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** N/A

**Notice Details:**

* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP) against Supply Arrangement E0225-150564 – Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Services SA list for Nova Scotia
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Trade Agreements:** The contract is eligible for the following trade agreements: Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement and others

**Project Overview:**

The government of Canada has launched a project to upgrade the paint mixing room and storage facilities in buildings D175 and D200. The goal of the project is to address ventilation and other code deficiencies.

**Eligibility:**

Only firms that have qualified under the Mechanical discipline for the province of Nova Scotia are eligible to participate in this tender. Firms must possess the required expertise and experience to assume the responsibilities and deliver the outcomes outlined in the project specifications.

**Submission Guidelines:**

Only proposals from eligible firms will be accepted. Proposals must be submitted electronically and must conform to the submission guidelines outlined in the Request for Proposal document.

**Contracting Entity:**

Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
Contact: Carlos Castillo Nieto (carlos.castillonieto@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Important Dates:**

- Publication Date: November 24, 2023
- Tender Closing Date: December 18, 2023, 14:00 (EST)
- Expected Contract Start Date: December 20, 2023
- Expected Contract End Date: N/A

**Contract Value:**

The contract value will be determined at the time of award. The contract is expected to be completed within a timeframe of approximately 6 months from the expected contract start date. Any
